content.name: Zhuofeng Wu
content.affiliation:
University of Michigan
Foreseer research group

meat.p: My research insterests lie primarily in the fields of crowdsourcing, data management and database system. My recent work is about developing human-in-the-loop data management systems and tools that people are willing to use for extracting value from data. I am also interested in big data systems and techniques. Currently I am a thesis-based master student advised by Prof. Jiannan Wang in the Database System Lab, Simon Fraser University.

p.title: Ph.D. student, School of Information
content: Advisors: Prof. Qiaozhu Mei, Prof. Daniel Romero

p.title: B.E. in Computer Science
content: Pursuit Science Class, Chu Kochen Honors College (CKC College)

p.title: Research Intern at the Alibaba Group
Research Assistant at the University of Michigan

content.title: Reprowd: Crowdsourced DataProcessing Made Reproducible
content.content: We present REPROWD, a system aiming to make it easy to reproduce crowdsourced data processing research. A key innovative aspect of the system is the CrowdData abstraction, which maps a crowdsourcing experiment to manipulations of a tabular dataset.

content.title: Towards Extracting Highlights From Recorded Live Videos: An Implicit Crowdsourcing Approach
content.content: Lightor is a system for extracting highlights from live streaming videos using implicit crowdsourcing
